Job Title: Head of Finance Systems & Data Analytics
Ad Text:
Melbourne, Victoria | RACV Head Office
Permanent Full Time | Hybrid Working (4 days a week in office)
A Competitive Salary | Discounts on Selected RACV Products
New Senior Finance Leadership role – a rare opportunity to build something exceptional

RACV is one of Australia’s most trusted organisations, providing a diverse range of services across motoring, insurance, travel, leisure, and home. With a strong legacy of innovation and a member-first ethos, we are seeking a strategic and technical leader to drive the future of our finance technology ecosystem.

About the Opportunity

We are seeking  a seasoned finance systems leader who thrives in ambiguity and excels at building capabilities from the ground up. With the introduction of Oracle Fusion Cloud ERP, we need a resilient, adaptable leader to establish the foundations, governance and team that will define our finance technology future.

As Head of Finance Systems and Data Analytics, you’ll be Oracle Fusion System Owner, you will be the gate-keeper of our new platform, standing up frameworks, building your team to lead the solution design, governance, and operational health of our core finance technology.

You will also be accountable for establishing and operating the Finance Data Governance Framework, ensuring every financial record is accurate, trusted, and transformed into timely, actionable insights.

Reporting to the GM Finance Transformation, this is a critical, hands-on leadership role that requires deep technical expertise in finance systems and a proven ability to lead finance data strategy in a complex, multi-system enterprise. This is an opportunity to make your mark and be part of an exciting finance transformation.

Come along for a new journey

You will partner closely with Finance, Technology, and the PMO to deliver scalable, future-ready systems. What makes this role exciting:

Build from the ground up: Establish the new Finance Systems team that will manage and support a suite of finance systems in the CFO division. 
Shape the future: You’re not inheriting legacy constraints; you’re designing the blueprint for finance technology at one of Australia’s most trusted organisations
Develop your team; Recruit, coach and build a high performing team with specialist skills in Oracle Fusion and data analytics
Be the gatekeeper: Own system integrity, controls and compliance while balancing the agility needed to support evolving business needs.
Navigate complexity: Work across Finance, Technology, business units and external partners, pivoting as priorities shift and requirements emerge.

Your main focus areas include:

Finance System Ownership & Configuration Leadership

Act as the Oracle Fusion System Owner, accountable for the operational system health, configuration governance, and quarterly updates.
Exercise functional design authority for all Oracle Fusion configurations, extensions, security, and integration design.
Own and govern the single Finance integration catalogue, data flows, and error-handling standards.
Direct all build, functional testing, regression testing, and release management activities for projects and quarterly updates.

System Support & Administration

Own the Finance Systems Health & Performance Dashboard and associated SLAs (availability, incident response, error rates).
Act as the Finance escalation owner for P1/P2 incidents, coordinating rapid resolution with Technology and AMS partners.
Govern segregation-of-duties, access controls, data privacy, and lead functional contribution to disaster recovery and cyber assurance testing.
Manage licensing consumption and optimisation of all finance systems.

Finance Data Governance & Master Data Stewardship

Establish, chair, and evolve the Finance Data Governance Council, policies, and operating rhythm, ensuring alignment with enterprise standards.
Define and maintain the single source of truth for finance data definitions, data glossary, ownership, and data lineage.
Own and govern the creation, maintenance, and decommissioning of all finance master data (Chart of Accounts, cost centres, suppliers, etc.).
Direct continuous data quality monitoring, root-cause analysis, and cleansing programs.

Finance Reporting & Analytics Strategy

Own the finance reporting and analytics roadmap (including Fusion Data Intelligence, OTBI, FRS, Oracle Analytics Cloud, and future data platforms).
Deliver and govern self-service analytics capabilities for Finance and approved business consumers.
Partner with the Enterprise Data, Strategy & Analytics team to ensure finance data assets are catalogued, discoverable, and reusable.

Stakeholder and People Leadership

Lead, coach, and develop a high-performing team, fostering innovation and professional growth.
Act as the key liaison for finance system vendors, consultants, and implementation partners.
Collaborate effectively with the Finance Leadership Team, Technology, Legal, and Business Units to embed data governance and align systems with strategic goals.

What you’ll need to be successful

Tertiary qualification in Accounting, Information Systems, or a related field.
10+ years' extensive experience managing finance systems and integrations in a complex, multi-system environment.
Proven track record of delivering at least two full-cycle ERP implementations or major cloud migrations as functional lead.
Deep functional understanding of core financial processes (GL, AP, AR, budgeting, reporting, procurement).
Deep understanding of financial data models, ERP structures, and reporting processes.
Proven ability to design and implement data governance frameworks and controls.
Excellent stakeholder management, leadership, and communication skills.

Highly Desirable

Experience in managing Cloud ERP and EPM, ideally Oracle Fusion.
Postgraduate qualification or professional certification (MBA, CPA/CA, CDMP, DAMA).
Experience with modern integration patterns (API frameworks) and analytics tools (Power BI, Tableau).

There’s so much on offer when you join RACV with benefits including

Our flexible and informal work environment which helps bring balance between work and home.
Generous discounts on home and car insurance policies and RACV roadside care
Great discounts across all RACV resorts
Discounts from corporate partners that are updated monthly.

Our difference

At RACV, we believe that maintaining a diverse and inclusive workplace is an important element in our continued success. We want our people to feel welcome, supported and appreciated for who they are and what they bring to our business. If you require any reasonable adjustments to the recruitment process and/or the role, please let our Talent Acquisition Team know.

Application process  

You can learn more about the RACV at careers.racv.com.au 

Applicants will be required to provide evidence of their eligibility to work in Australia, and consent to a criminal record check. 

At RACV, we believe that maintaining a diverse and inclusive workplace is an important element in our continued success. We want our people to feel welcome, supported and appreciated for who they are and what they bring to our business. If you require any reasonable adjustments to the recruitment process and/or the role, please let our Talent Acquisition Team know.

The Opportunity

Morgans is seeking a dynamic Business Intelligence Developer to join our iServices team. In this role, you’ll deliver modern data solutions to support strategic decision-making, including implementing a cloud data platform (FiveTran, DBT, Snowflake, PowerBI, Salesforce), enabling enterprise reporting, and building automated data warehousing. You’ll apply advanced SQL and modelling techniques—Relational, Dimensional, DataVault, Salesforce Object Model, PowerBI Tabular, and DAX—while documenting data definitions and providing backup support to the BI team. This is a great opportunity for a proactive professional passionate about turning data into actionable insights.

What you will be doing

Deliver major project outcomes within agreed timeframes and quality standards.
Collaborate with developers, project managers, and business analysts to design, maintain, and enhance BI applications.
Develop and maintain change control and testing processes for data models and databases.
Produce ad-hoc queries, reports, and curated datasets to meet business needs.
Identify opportunities to improve data delivery, capture, and business processes through technical solutions.
Document data definitions and ensure clarity for stakeholders.
Provide support for the smooth operation of the iServices team as required.

What you will bring

5+ years’ experience in data-related projects (BI, data management, migrations, or database development).
Strong SQL skills, including complex functions, scripts, stored procedures, views, and triggers.
Expertise in data modelling (Relational, Dimensional, DataVault) and database design best practices.
Experience with data analysis, reporting, and PowerBI (including Tabular models and DAX).
Familiarity with software development lifecycle, DBT or similar BI automation tools, and Azure DevOps.
Demonstrated experience (Minimum 2 years) in modern cloud data platform (FiveTran, DBT, Snowflake, PowerBI)
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and attention-to-detail skills.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to work collaboratively.
Self-motivated with effective prioritisation and deadline management.

Desirable

Experience with Snowflake, Salesforce, FiveTran, JAMS scheduling.
Programming skills in C# and PowerShell.
Exposure to Agile/SCRUM methodologies and finance industry.
Tertiary qualification in IT or related discipline.

About Morgans

Morgans is Australia’s largest full-service stockbroking and wealth management network providing a range of wealth management, investment advice and corporate finance services. We pride ourselves on our people, expertise, core values, and diversity.

Yes, I want to apply!

If you are interested in this role and would like to join the Morgans team, please click apply and submit your cover letter and resume.

We believe in creating opportunities for everyone and welcome applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences. We can’t wait to hear from you!

Benefits

Eligible to participate in bonus scheme.
Learning and development opportunities including Morgans' Mentoring program.
Positive impact on the community through the Morgans Foundation and paid volunteer days.

Energy Power Systems Australia (EPSA) is an authorised supplier of Cat® power systems in Australia, PNG, and the Solomon Islands. As a leading provider of sustainable energy solutions, EPSA provides new and used engines, generators, batteries, and hybrid energy systems for a broad range of industries. We also specialise in rental solutions for power generators, compressors, and temperature control systems. We are committed to providing our customers with the sustainable power they need, leading the way for renewable energy with Cat® Hybrid Energy Systems incorporating battery energy storage.

At Energy Power Systems Australia (EPSA), we keep the country moving. From powering major infrastructure projects to delivering reliable energy solutions for mining, construction, and industry.

Now, we’re seeking a Customer & Market Insights Manager to join our team at the Mulgrave head office. This is your opportunity to lead customer and market intelligence, deliver actionable insights, and shape strategic decisions that drive EPSA’s growth.

This role offers a hybrid working arrangement, with regular collaboration at our Mulgrave head office.




Why you’ll love this role:

Lead the development and execution of customer and market insights strategy for a dynamic, future-focused business.

Drive continuous improvement in data analytics, reporting, and research practices.

Collaborate with senior management, commercial, and sales teams to influence strategic decisions.

Own market research, customer segmentation, competitor analysis, and trend forecasting.

Influence business planning and growth initiatives with data-driven recommendations.

Competitive salary and a culture that values safety, accountability, and excellence.

Career development opportunities in a leading energy solutions provider.




What you’ll be doing (but not limited to!):

Develop and deliver EPSA’s customer and market insights strategy.

Analyse market trends, customer behaviour, and competitor activity to identify opportunities.

Design and implement research projects, including customer satisfaction and market analysis.

Provide actionable insights through dashboards, reports, and presentations to senior stakeholders.

Support pricing, segmentation, and commercial strategies with robust data analysis.

Monitor industry developments and economic indicators impacting key sectors (resources, utilities, defence).

Drive continuous improvement in analytics and reporting frameworks.

Ensure compliance with corporate governance, policy, and risk controls.


What makes you successful:

Proven experience (ideally 7+ years) in customer experience, customer insights, or service design within complex B2B environments.

Demonstrated ability to design and manage customer research programs, including Voice of Customer (VoC), journey mapping, and segmentation initiatives.

Strong analytical and storytelling skills—able to translate qualitative and quantitative data into meaningful insights and strategic action.

Experience with market intelligence, competitor analysis, and leveraging market segmentation data to inform business decisions.

High-level influencing skills and the ability to work across silos to embed customer-first thinking.

Familiarity with CX measurement frameworks (e.g., NPS/NLS, customer journey maps, VoC strategies).

Excellent stakeholder engagement and communication skills, with the ability to present insights clearly to senior leaders.

Strong project management capability, with a track record of delivering enterprise CX initiatives on time and on budget.

Tertiary qualifications in Marketing, Business, Economics, or a related discipline are highly regarded.

Experience in the energy, industrial, or related sectors is desirable.


Why work with us? Here are some of the benefits of working for EPSA: 

Seamless Onboarding Experience: Start strong with our centralised induction program at our Mulgrave (VIC) head office, designed to set you up for success. 

Celebrate You: Enjoy paid leave on your birthday and take time to give back with volunteer leave. 

Exclusive Discounts: Access a wide range of retail discounts, plus special pricing on CAT® merchandise and health insurance. 

Drive Your Way: Take advantage of our vehicle novated lease options to make your commute more rewarding. 

Support for Families: We offer paid parental leave to support you during life's most important moments. 

Refer & Be Rewarded: Earn generous rewards through our team member referral program. 

Grow with Us: Upskill with job-relevant education support, including access to Cat® University and other learning & development opportunities. 

Recognition Matters: Be celebrated through our Employee Recognition Program and Service Awards. 

Wellbeing First: Access confidential support anytime through our Employee Assistance Program (EAP). 


Ready to shape the future of customer experience and market intelligence at EPSA?

If you’re passionate about turning insights into action and want to make a real impact in a dynamic, solution-oriented business, we’d love to hear from you.

Newly created job for a Business Analyst with expertise in the Superannuation industry.

The project you will be working on will be focused on strategic initiatives - impact assessments, policy review, governance analysis.

The Business Analyst responsible for interrogating problem spaces, documenting findings and deliver project outcomes in line with regulatory requirements, member expectations, and our organisational strategy.

Skill set / Experience needed:

Proven background working as a Business Analyst in the Superannuation domain or a regulated financial services environment
Project experience across strategy and/or transformation
Experience working with CxO level stakeholders to gather requirements re policy and governance changes
Experience conducting change impact assessments on policy and governance frameworks
Any experience on merger / de-merger projects would be beneficial
Strong knowledge of superannuation operations and regulatory obligations preferred, with industry qualifications (RG146 or equivalent) highly regarded
Excellent skills in stakeholder management and facilitating discussions across various levels of seniority
Collaborative and pragmatic mindset, with the ability to build and maintain strong working relationships with colleagues, clients, and key stakeholders
Ability to balance detail-oriented analysis with delivery-focused project oversight
Ability to work within a self-directed culture and navigate ambiguity
Possess intermediate to advanced level skills, knowledge and experience in the practical application of Microsoft Office applications including but not limited to SQL, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, SharePoint and Outlook.
A broad understanding of business and information technology including database management.

This role will start as a 12 month fixed term contract.


The client offers a very flexible workplace, 1-2 days in office per week.

Reference Number: 06800-0013352902

Job Title: AI / LLM Data Scientist - Leading Consultancy
Ad Text:
AI / LLM Data Scientist - Leading AI Consultancy 
Location - Sydney only (2 days max in the office, rest from home!) - no remote / overseas options!

Ready to make an impact with AI? Join a leading AI consultancy where innovation, impact, and cutting-edge tech come together. The AI team is a powerhouse of designers, developers, data scientists, and analysts delivering next-gen digital products and AI solutions across various industries. They are growing rapidly and looking to hire AI passionate data scientists in thier team!!

About the role

As an AI Data Scientist you’ll design and develop AI-driven products and solutions that transform how their clients work and create measurable outcomes. You’ll work with cross-functional teams, mentor junior data scientists, and drive the adoption of modern AI and ML practices.

What you’ll do

Collaborate with teams to scope and design AI solutions.
Develop algorithms to extract, clean, and normalise large-scale data.
Build, test, and deploy models and pipelines (RAG, LLM workflows, VectorDBs) at scale in Azure.
Write clean, efficient, production-ready code.
Contribute to forums and communities, sharing best practice.
Mentor and coach junior talent.
What we’re looking for

Minimum 3-5+ years' experience working across end to end Data Science projects with hands-on experience in AI/ RAG/ LLM/- previous experience working in the consulting sector a big plus!
Strong Python development with modern LLM/ML frameworks.
Expertise in LLM prompting, workflows, and agentic systems a big plus!
Experience with VectorDB (Azure AI Search, pgVector, etc.).
Knowledge of ML models, CNNs, RNNs, NLP, and CV good to have.
Proven hands-on experience with RAG pipelines a big plus!
SQL and Vector DB expertise, plus cloud development (Azure - highly recommended). 
Strong critical thinking, collaboration, and communication skills.
Tech stack & extras
Good to have experience in - Git, Docker, microservices, ReactJS/NodeJS, observability standards (OpenTelemetry), message-queueing (Kafka/RabbitMQ), data pipelines at scale, and Agile delivery.

Why us?

At this leading AI consultancy, you’ll join a diverse, inclusive environment that champions creativity and innovation. They offer flexible work, world-class development opportunities, mentoring, and wellness benefits—so you can thrive personally and professionally.

Please apply on-line or for more information please contact Kausty Mahajan at Bluefin Resources on 02 9270 2603.

Senior Analyst – Defence Strategy




About the Role

The Defence Strategy Program is seeking an experienced Senior Analyst capable of producing influential research and briefing senior policymakers, who has recognised subject-matter expertise and a credible reputation.  The Senior Analyst will conduct rigorous research and analysis and contribute to ASPI events that enhance contestable advice to government and contribute to public debate and understanding of defence and strategic affairs. The successful candidate will lead independent research, produce high-impact analysis, and engage with government, industry, and international partners on key strategic issues shaping Australia’s security environment. The Senior Analyst will shape the institute’s defence research agenda, focusing on matters related to U.S.–allied/partner cooperation, Southeast Asia geopolitics, regional security architecture, deterrence and denial concepts, maritime security, China and the PLA, defence industry policy and economics, defence capability, force posture, force design, and joint operations and planning.

Duty Statement

·         Conduct original research resulting in evidence-based analysis, to include development of policy-relevant recommendations for high-impact publications.

·         Manage major research projects, overseeing timelines, budgets, and ensuring the delivery of high-quality outputs, to include commissioned publications.

·         Publish timely analysis in response to significant regional or global events, to include media engagement activities (social media, responding to media inquiries) as agreed to with senior staff.

·         Provide authoritative strategic advice and policy recommendations to senior leadership within domestic and foreign government agencies and external stakeholders.

·         Represent ASPI as a speaker or moderator at forums, conferences, and briefings.

·         Deliver or contribute to impactful events from conception to execution.

·         Cultivate and maintain strong relationships with a wide range of stakeholders, representing ASPI's expertise and promoting its work.

·         Mentor junior analysts and Defence Fellows.

·         Build networks with domestic and international governments, militaries, industry, academia and think tanks.

·         Contribute strategically to ASPI's forward research agenda.

 

Selection Criteria

Essential:

·         Advanced Research, Analytical and Writing Skills: Ability to design and execute complex research methodologies, critically analyse information from diverse sources, and develop evidence-based conclusions. Strong writing skills and an existing publication track record.

·         Strategic Thinking: Capacity to understand the broader strategic context, identify emerging trends, communicate complex concepts clearly, and develop forward-looking, actionable policy recommendations.

·         Policy Analysis and Development: Expertise in analysing existing policies, identifying gaps, and developing innovative, constructive and practical policy solutions.

·         Project Management: Proven ability to manage complex research or event projects, including planning, resource allocation, risk assessment, and stakeholder management. An ability to work independently and manage multiple projects and requirements beyond research.

·         Subject Matter Expertise: At least 10+ years’ experience working on defence and security matters working in or alongside government or military, industry, think tanks or academic institutions.

Desirable:

·         Experience working in government, preferably in Defence, DFAT, ADF, Intelligence Community, or an allied or partner government or as an academic with demonstrated expertise in Australian defence matters.

·         Evidence of published analysis or research in reputable outlets on relevant defence topics.

·         Experience sourcing and writing funding/grant proposals.

·         Organise public events, closed-door roundtables, and expert workshops.

·         Postgraduate qualifications, Master’s or PhD, in a relevant field (e.g., International Relations, Security Studies, Political Science, Defence Studies, Economics, or similar).

 

About ASPI

The Australian Strategic Policy Institute (ASPI) is an independent, non-partisan think tank that produces expert and timely advice for political, strategic and security leaders in Australia and the Indo-Pacific region.

ASPI was established by the Australian Government in 2001 to provide independent advice on Defence and strategic issues. ASPI’s Charter, which guides all our work, explains the government’s aims in establishing ASPI as:  

·         Improving the quality of policy advice received by government by providing contestability. 

·         Nourishing public debate and understanding of Defence and strategic affairs.  

·         Developing professional strategic policy expertise in Australia.  

ASPI’s Defence Strategy Program analyses how Australia defends its national interests in an era of intensifying strategic competition. Our research focuses on three areas: Australia’s security environment and regional partnerships; developing military strategy, deterrence and denial concepts, and future force design; and strengthening the defence industrial base, supply chains, and economic resilience. Together, these efforts provide government, industry, and the public with evidence‑based insights to enhance Australia’s defence and security.

ASPI Values

·         Independent – Conducting impartial, balanced, and objective analysis;

·         Rigorous – Applying structured research methods and evidence-based reasoning;

·         Innovative – Bringing fresh thinking to emerging security challenges;

·         Engaging – Communicating ideas clearly and collaborating respectfully;

·         Collegial – Contributing to a professional, inclusive, and respectful work culture;

·         Impactful – Supporting outcomes that influence policy and public debate.

      

How to Apply

1.       Please refer to the position description attached.

2.       All applications should be submitted to jobs@aspi.org.au including the following documents:

·         Cover letter (addressing the Position Description and selection criteria) not to exceed three pages.

·         Resume/CV including two current referee contact details.

ASPI promotes a workplace that actively seeks to include, welcome and values unique contributions of all people. The Institute strongly encourages women and people from diverse cultural backgrounds including applicants from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander backgrounds to apply.

Preference will be given to Australian citizens or residents, but ASPI will consider visa sponsorship for exceptional international candidates.

The closing date for applications is Thursday, 29 January 2026.

Company Description

MAKE IT AMAZING

At Sydney Airport, the future of air travel is shaped by you.

As a team, we connect the world. More than just a hub of activity and boundless energy, we’re creating a destination of amazing experiences. Like seeing wonderful moments unfold in front of you, knowing “I made that possible!”.

Dynamic. Fast-paced. We thrive in a place where fresh challenges land daily. Backed by positive and supportive team players and inspiring leaders, we adapt to change. Driven to grow. Owning every action. To do things better.

As smart, problem-solvers, we are always learning and growing. And that’s easier to do alongside passionate experts, as we collaborate across teams readily sharing our knowledge.

Each day is a new journey, as we bring an exciting vision to life. With significant capital investment in new, improved infrastructure, there’s never been a better time to expand your potential at Sydney Airport. The range of responsibilities and diverse pathways you can take on with us, are surprising.

We are SYD. United in the pride that comes with welcoming the world at Australia’s premier gateway.

Job Description

About the team

This role sits within our Aviation Growth & Group Strategy function, one of the key contributors to value creation at Sydney Airport. You will be part of a team focused on shaping the future revenue trajectory for Sydney Airport through innovative aviation products, compelling propositions for airline partners and data‑driven insights. 

About the role

You’ll sponsor and support the development and commercialisation of aviation products and services, combining strategic commercial work with hands‑on analytics. Day‑to‑day, you will:

Develop proposals and pitch materials for airline partnerships, backed by rigorous analysis of performance, demand, capacity and pricing. 
Build full business cases and materials to support approvals (LT, IC, Board) across the initiative lifecycle. 
Work closely with stakeholders across the airport - including Operations, Finance, Planning & Delivery, Government Relations, Sustainability and Legal - to drive outcomes. 
Interrogate large datasets to uncover insights, forecast capacity and performance, and inform strategy recommendations for the Aviation Commercial team. 
Collaborate with external consultants and airline contacts, building strong relationships and an understanding of commercial drivers and propensity to pay. 

Please note this is a 7 month fixed term contract. Applications will be reviwed early January 2026.

About you

You thrive in complex, dynamic environments and are comfortable balancing strategic thinking with deep analytical work. 

Degree‑qualified in data analytics, business, economics or finance (or similar). 
5+ years’ experience in commercial/strategic analytics (management consulting or advisory a plus); aviation or infrastructure exposure is advantageous. 
Advanced Excel; strong ability to structure insights in PowerPoint and concise written formats. 
Proven stakeholder management and influencing skills, with a clear and confident communication style across senior audiences. 
Highly organised, detail‑oriented and self‑driven, with the ability to manage competing priorities and deliver under time pressure.


What we offer

To find out more about the amazing work environment here at SYD, be sure to check out the Join us section of Sydney Airport’s website, where you can also see more about our flexible culture and work practices, alongside our other Employee benefits, or take a look at our LinkedIn Sydney Airport: Life page.

Make it Amazing

SYD is an Equal Opportunity Employer and encourages all suitably qualified applicants to apply, including First Nations Australians, and people from culturally diverse backgrounds.

AccessEAP is an Australian-owned, not-for-profit organisation with over 30 years of experience in the Employee Assistance Program (EAP) industry. As one of the founding members of the sector, we’re proud to have helped shape best practice across a broad range of industries.

Our mission since 1989 has been to improve workplace wellbeing and support Australians’ mental health. We provide services such as EAP counselling, critical incident response, onsite and remote support, psychosocial risk management, and tailored wellbeing consultation to help individuals and organisations thrive.

We are looking for a Digital Innovator to lead our business transformation. Reporting to the CEO, step into a pivotal role where you’ll drive the delivery of digital transformation initiatives that align with our business objectives.

This is a 12 month maximum term contract. Applications close 5 January 2026 and won't be reviewed until this time.

Key Responsibilities

Lead Digital Transformation: Plan, execute, and deliver technology initiatives on time and within budget.

Change Management: Drive adoption of new tools and processes, design training programs, and create user-friendly resources.

Executive & Stakeholder Engagement: Align projects with organisational strategy, provide updates to leadership, and manage expectations across teams.

Project Governance: Manage sprints, workflows, milestones, and compliance with governance standards.

Budget & Resource Management: Maintain financial discipline and optimise resource allocation.

Technical Oversight: Use Azure DevOps/Jira for tracking; collaborate with development and QA teams to meet UAT standards.

Risk & Quality Management: Identify risks, implement QA processes, and ensure continuous improvement.

What We’re Looking For

Tertiary qualifications in Project Management, IT, or Business.

PMP, PRINCE2, Agile/Scrum highly regarded.

Proven track record in managing complex digital transformation projects.

Exposure to C#, .NET, Angular desirable.

Strong stakeholder engagement, change management, and communication skills.

Proficiency in Azure DevOps or Jira.

Collaborative, solution-oriented, and results-driven with high professionalism and confidentiality.

Experience in the Mental Health industry highly regarded.

This role sits within a national security agency that plays a key role in Australia’s National Intelligence Community.

The agency operates at the intersection of data, technology and operational intelligence, integrating vast, complex data sets to support real-world investigations and high-impact decision-making.
 
The work directly enables operational analytics used to disrupt serious and organised crime, financial crime and national security threats.
 
The Opportunity

You will join a small, highly technical team building a data collection and integration hub that enables secure data sharing across internal platforms and trusted external partners.

This is a hands-on Senior Data Engineer role focused on API design, data integration and scalable architecture, with your work directly consumed by operational and intelligence teams.

Work on mission-critical systems supporting operational intelligence
Design and own APIs that connect large, sensitive data sets
Modern data stack, strong engineering standards, and real technical depth
The Role

This role blends data engineering with software API engineering, with API and integration work accounting for around 30–50% of the role.

You will:

Design, build and manage RESTful APIs, including gateways, authentication and secure access
Develop data integration pipelines to ingest large, complex data sets from internal and external sources
Work with big data frameworks and Python/SQL to process and prepare data for operational use
Collaborate with software engineers and architects to embed APIs into mission-critical systems
Contribute to scalable technical design, engineering standards and CI/CD practices
 
The Ideal Person

You are a senior data engineer with 5+ years’ experience working in complex, highly regulated environments and are motivated by work that has a clear operational impact.
 
You bring strong hands-on experience across API engineering (REST, integrations, gateways) alongside core data engineering skills using Python, SQL and modern big data frameworks.

You likely have experience within the national security, intelligence, Defence, ATO, consulting or major financial institutions. Experience with Palantir Foundry would be well-regarded but is not essential.
 
Due to the nature of the work, Australian Citizenship and an active NV1 clearance is mandatory.
 
Salary / Rate

This is a full-time contract commencing in February for an initial 6 month (into the next financial year) with likely 2x 3-month extensions.

A rate is not listed; however, my estimation range; however, it would be $135/hr- $160/hr based on skills and experience.
 
How to Apply

To apply online, please click on the appropriate link.
 
Alternatively, for a confidential discussion, please contact Lucas Walker on 0483 911 561 quoting ref no. 21219
 
HorizonOne is committed to building a diverse and inclusive workforce and we encourage applications from people of all cultures, capabilities and backgrounds.

Job Title: Director, Commercial Payments Practice Lead, Visa Consulting & Analytics
Ad Text:
Company Description


Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose – to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.

Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.

Job Description


Team Summary

Visa Consulting & Analytics (VCA) is Visa's consulting division, serving Visa's clients (including card issuers, acquirers, and merchants) and solving their strategic problems focused on improving performance and profitability.  Drawing on our expertise in strategy consulting, payments, data analytics, marketing, operational and macroeconomics, VCA drives high impact and tangible financial results.

The VCA team within Australia provides a comprehensive range of consulting services and solutions to our clients in Australia and New Zealand, that address unique challenges in areas such as strategic growth, profitability, risk management and digital strategy.        

The Role

We are currently looking for a Director to lead VCA’s Commercial Payments Practice for the AuNZPI region. The Commercial Payments Practice supports our clients to create and launch market-leading business payments solutions, derive greater value from the active management of their existing business cards portfolios, and identify new strategic growth opportunities. 

As the Practice lead, the Director will be responsible for growing the Commerical Payments Practice through business development, leading and delivering consulting engagements, and developing new solutions to continuously enhance and diversify the Practice’s client offerings.

In this role, the Director will lead a small team of consultants and collaborate with cross-functional experts across Visa’s business to jointly develop client proposals, participate in client sales activities and ensure client engagements are delivered with excellence. The full range of responsibilities are detailed below:

Responsibilities

On a project-by-project basis:

Prepare client project proposals, clarifying objectives, scope, deliverables, approach, dependencies, roles and responsibilities, draw input from clients, local client relationship managers and functional teams.
Oversee project setup including contracting documentation, stakeholder engagement, interview guides and client data requirements.
Develop a fact base by undertaking client interviews, collecting and analysing inputs such as client data, process flows, policies, competitive, industry and environmental information.
Analyse Visa and client data to conduct benchmarking, identify performance gaps and improvement opportunities.
Collaborate with data science team members to leverage data analytics capabilities
Manage execution of one or more project engagements, building client relationships, utilising governance frameworks and mitigating or resolving complex problems that emerge.
Identify solutions and recommendations that address client objectives and result in performance improvement, leverage relevant VCA methodologies, frameworks and global best practices.
Design and deliver compelling presentations to illustrate findings, ideas, recommendations within consulting engagements and more broadly and at times support implementation at the client onsite.

More generally:

Identify and surface opportunities for client projects.
Create, develop and maintain VCA IP and consulting offerings.
Continuously build knowledge, surface new insights and produce thought leadership pieces that contribute to practice development and global best practice.

This is a hybrid position. Expectation of days in office will be confirmed by your hiring manager. This role can be based in either Sydney or Melbourne.

Qualifications


Having already accumulated a variety of experience, you will be familiar with the payments industry and keen to work alongside an experienced team in gaining a deeper understanding. You will be client driven, comfortable managing a project end to end and relishing the opportunity to work closely with clients to influence their future performance.

Specific skills and experience you may bring are:

10+ years in consulting, business management or product management.
Deep experience in strategy consulting.
Deep experience in SMB or Corporate banking and / or payments solutions.
Deep experience in product P&L or portfolio management.
Superior analytical and problem solving skills, with demonstrated intellectual and analytical rigor.
Strong team orientation with a collaborative, diplomatic, and flexible style and be able to work effectively in a matrixed organisation.
Excellent detail orientation, ensuring the highest level of quality and rigour in reports and data analysis.
Excellent presentation skills, including strong oral and written capabilities.
Self-motivated, results-oriented individual with the ability to progress multiple priorities concurrently.
Experience in and passion for the power of analytics to inform and drive strategy and tactics, and proven ability to generate insights from data.
Strong commercial acumen, with experience in working on business cases that prove ROI.

Additional Information


Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

Group Manager, Engineering, Data & Analytics




Are you ready to make a real impact in Australia’s energy transition?




At AusNet, we play a key role in the energy transition and provide essential energy to Victorian households and businesses.




Help us lead the way, while enriching your career with real people who encourage you to bring your best and make real impact – for your career, our communities and Australia’s clean energy future.




About the role




We are seeking a Group Manager, Engineering, Data & Analytics to join our Group Operations function. This key leadership role is responsible for enterprise delivery of engineering and data analytics enablement and support. Acting as the technical authority on engineering standards, design integrity, and alignment with strategic asset and lifecycle management principles, you will establish and reinforce enterprise standards and continuous improvement for engineering and data practices. You will also own data governance frameworks and build enterprise capability and thought leadership across these disciplines.




Key Responsibilities




Act as the enterprise technical authority across engineering disciplines.

Lead and mentor Principal Engineers and subject matter experts to ensure consistent application of engineering standards, technical risk management, and design integrity.

Provide expert technical input into capital investment proposals and business cases.

Lead or oversee investigations into significant technical incidents and ensure rigorous root cause analysis informs improvements.

Establish and maintain enterprise-wide data governance frameworks, ensuring data quality, integrity, and accessibility.

Enable advanced analytics capabilities to support data-driven decision-making across Lines of Business.

Collaborate with Asset Management teams to define asset strategies and lifecycle management approaches.

Define and reinforce enterprise standards for engineering and data practices, driving consistency and continuous improvement.

Build and lead communities of practice across engineering and analytics disciplines.

Partner with Lines of Business to provide expert support and facilitate cross-functional collaboration.

Manage people-related responsibilities including performance reviews, recruitment, onboarding, and capability development.







What You’ll Bring




You will bring strong expertise in engineering principles across infrastructure or asset-intensive industries, combined with deep knowledge of data governance, architecture, and analytics platforms. Your background includes leading engineering governance and technical standards, driving enterprise data initiatives, and partnering on asset strategies and lifecycle planning. Experience managing cross-functional teams, overseeing complex assets, and embedding learnings from technical investigations is essential.







Qualifications:




Bachelor’s degree in engineering (Electrical, Mechanical, Civil, or Systems) or related technical discipline.

Postgraduate qualifications in Engineering, Data Analytics, or Business Administration (MBA) highly desirable.

Chartered Professional Engineer (CPEng) status and registration as Professional Engineer (or eligible in Victoria).

Member of Engineers Australia (Fellow or eligible).










Skills:




Significant experience in engineering governance and technical standards development.

Proven track record in leading enterprise data governance and analytics initiatives.

Experience partnering with asset management teams and managing cross-functional teams.

Demonstrated leadership in technical incident investigations and embedding learnings into practice.

Exceptional leadership and people management skills.

Advanced analytical and problem-solving abilities.

Strong stakeholder engagement and influencing skills.

Excellent communication skills for diverse audiences.

Strategic thinking and planning capabilities.

Skilled in continuous improvement and innovation.







Please note, we will not be engaging in Recruitment agencies for this role, please apply directly!







A real place to belong.




We celebrate unique voices, refreshing perspectives and diversity in our team. Engage and connect through our social club, wide range of events or by joining one of our Employee Network Groups.




We believe in more than just competitive pay. Here’s what sets us apart:




Leave: more than typical personal leave and a generous 14 weeks of paid parental leave, with no minimum service.

Community giving: a paid day to volunteer with our social impact partner, Foodbank, or for a cause that matters to you.

Perks: we offer all the other perks you’ve come to expect like purchased leave, income protection insurance, novated leasing, corporate discounts, private health cover discounts and more.




As an industry in transformation, we’re excited by the possibilities ahead.




So, if you’re passionate about our purpose and committed to making real progress, bring your energy and join AusNet. Together, we can shape a new way forward.

Our client in the higher education sector is looking for a Strong Functional Business Analyst to join the team. You will be instrumental in supporting BAU activities and driving various technical initiatives across our core student administration systems, primarily TechnologyOne Student Management. This role requires a strong emphasis on technical analysis, business process optimisation, and the delivery of high-quality functional and technical specifications.

Key Responsibilities

Technical & Functional Analysis: Lead end-to-end technical/functional analysis for bugs, enhancements, integrations, and support tickets.

Vendor Management: Analyse vendor release notes, assess system impacts, and translate them into actionable requirements.

Documentation: Capture, document, and translate technical and business requirements into clear specifications (technical designs, functional designs, user journeys) for development and architecture teams.

Stakeholder Engagement: Facilitate workshops with Business Owners, SMEs, and technical teams, and manage communication across all stakeholders.

Agile Delivery: Support Agile processes including sprint ceremonies, backlog refinement, prioritisation, and provide testing support (UAT planning, test data preparation).

Essential Skills & Experience

The successful candidate will demonstrate:

Extensive experience as a Senior Functional or Technical Analyst in complex enterprise environments.

Strong understanding of the Systems Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and Agile methodologies.

Proven expertise in Business Process Management (BPM) and Business Process Re-engineering (BPR).

High-level proficiency in SQL (querying, analysing, and validating data).

Demonstrated experience with TechnologyOne Student Management and/or Oracle Cloud.

Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work autonomously with strong accountability.

High-level written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to translate complex technical concepts.

Desirable Experience

Experience in the Higher Education sector is highly regarded.

At Randstad, we are passionate about providing equal employment opportunities and embracing diversity to the benefit of all. We actively encourage applications from any background.

Senior Technical Business Analyst

Location: Sydney
Type: 2 year FTC| Full-time

Salary: $150k - $170k + super + bonus based on relevant experience

We're looking for a Senior Technical Business Analyst to join a large transformation program.

What You'll Do

Act as a key bridge between stakeholders, engineers, and delivery teams

Elicit, analyse, and document complex business and technical requirements

Work hands-on with application teams, getting into the detail of system behaviour, integrations, and data flows

Support solution design, collaborating with architects and developers to shape robust, scalable solutions

Analyse data and perform data extraction using SQL to support requirements, analysis, and decision-making

Review and understand code where needed to validate feasibility and impact

Translate business needs into clear functional and non-functional specifications

Support delivery through the full lifecycle, from discovery through to implementation

What You'll Bring

Strong background in Computer Science or a closely related technical discipline

Proven experience within banking technology programs

Proven experience as a Senior Technical Business Analyst in complex technology environments

Ability to read and understand code (as a Tech BA)

Experience with solution design or close collaboration with solution architects (highly desirable)

Solid hands-on experience with data extraction and SQL

Deep understanding of applications, APIs, and system integrations

Comfortable working at a detailed, technical level while still communicating clearly with non-technical stakeholders

Strong documentation, analysis, and stakeholder management skills

Candidates must be based in Sydney with full work rights - Citizen or PR. Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

A lot of data science roles talk about impact.
This one expects it.

You’ll be working on AI and GenAI powered features that sit directly in front of customers. Not internal dashboards. Not science projects. Actual product functionality where success is measured by whether it improves the experience and stands up in the real world.

This team is building ML and LLM driven capabilities into products used by thousands of customers. That brings real constraints, real trade offs, and real accountability. You’ll be working in domains where correctness, trust, and compliance matter as much as innovation.

They’ve moved past asking “can we do this?”.
Now the question is “is this the right thing to build, and how do we prove it works?”

What you’ll be doing This is an end to end role. If you like owning problems rather than just parts of them, you’ll feel at home.

Partnering closely with product managers to frame hypotheses and decide what’s worth building.
Designing experiments and evaluation approaches that run through the full product lifecycle, not just at launch.
Prototyping and validating GenAI and ML based solutions, then helping drive them through MVP and into production.
Working across NLP, retrieval, forecasting, recommendations and anomaly detection, depending on the product area.
Defining success metrics that matter to customers and the business, then using them to guide iteration.
Running offline evaluations and online experiments to understand real customer and commercial impact.
Working closely with ML Engineers and frontend teams to ship reliable, measurable and safe solutions.
Operating comfortably in regulated, risk aware environments where models need to behave predictably.
Sharing knowledge and influencing how data science is practiced beyond your own work.
You won’t be judged on how clever your model is. You’ll be judged on whether it improves the product.

Who this suits
You’ve shipped customer facing ML or GenAI features before. You’ve seen what happens when something goes live, and you understand how different that is from internal work.

Hands on GenAI experience is essential here. You’ve worked with LLM based systems, evaluation approaches, and the trade offs involved in deploying them to customers.

You bring a hypothesis driven mindset. You’re comfortable exploring complex systems, testing assumptions, and using evidence to guide decisions.

You’re technically solid. Strong Python, comfortable with data wrangling and modern ML tooling. You don’t need to be the strongest engineer in the room, but you need to be credible with those who are.

You operate as a senior. You influence peers, work across product, engineering, risk and legal, and communicate clearly when the subject matter is sensitive or ambiguous.

A PhD is welcome but not required. Evidence that your work has had impact beyond your own tasks matters more.

What’s in it for you
You’ll work on meaningful AI products with real users and real consequences, alongside strong ML Engineers and product leaders.

You’ll have room to shape how experimentation, evaluation and data science thinking show up in product decisions, not just in post hoc analysis.

Melbourne based team, with a preference for regular in person collaboration.

If you want a data science role where GenAI is real, experimentation matters, and your work ends up in customers’ hands, this is worth a conversation.

0491011875 
domninic@justdigitalpeople.com.au

Category:
Strategy & Planning (Consulting & Strategy)
Government - State (Government & Defence)
Ad Text:
Your new opportunity:
Join Queensland Treasury's Commercial team as a Principal Commercial Analyst on a contract until June 2028 and play a vital role in delivering major strategic policy and infrastructure initiatives. Collaborate with private industry and government departments to shape the future of Queensland's resources landscape, driving innovation and sustainable growth.

This is your chance to contribute your financial and commercial expertise to elevate projects, analyse critical documentation, and deliver outcomes that matter to Queenslanders. Be a part of a dynamic team that values collaboration, strategic insight, and impactful decision-making. Whether you have experience in resources, business, or government, this role offers a unique opportunity to use your skills to make a lasting difference.

In this role, you will:
• Deliver commercial and financial advice to support government priorities in the resources and energy sector.
• Evaluate major projects, providing analysis of drivers, risks, and strategic opportunities.
• Draft high-quality briefs and funding requests for resources and energy initiatives.
• Manage stakeholder relationships to ensure collaborative project delivery success.
• Coordinate input into whole-of-government activities and responses related to the resources industry.
• Build and leverage networks within resources and energy sectors to inform advice and initiatives.

What experience you will bring:
• Proven ability to engage and manage stakeholders effectively.
• Experience producing high-quality, independent commercial advice to support decision-making.
• Strong skills in project management, ensuring objectives are met efficiently.
• Ability to distil complex commercial concepts into clear, actionable insights.
• Solid understanding of Queensland's resources and energy projects.
• Background in resources, business, or government roles with demonstrated expertise in analysing financial models and documents.

Whilst there are no mandatory qualifications needed for this role, relevant qualifications will be highly regarded.

How to apply:
To submit your application, click on the Apply link to provide:
• Your resume detailing relevant experience.
• A cover letter of no more than two pages outlining why you are interested in this position and how your knowledge, skills and experience makes you a strong candidate for the role.

Queensland Treasury is committed to building an inclusive and diverse workforce that reflects the community we serve and treating all applicants equitably. This starts with recruitment, including making reasonable adjustments to support applicants at all stages of the process.

We welcome applicants to share with the hiring manager any health condition, disability and/or cultural or linguistic background, so that we may make any necessary adjustments to enable you to equitably participate in the recruitment process.

Applications to remain current for 12 months.

Job Ad Reference: QLD/673749/25

Closing Date:  Thursday, 08 January 2026
